result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Joles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other treatment or counseling deemed appropriate by agents.

defendant.name: Joles, Matthew D

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

1:36 PM Defendant Matthew D Joles in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 22CF22 and 22CF77. Court notes defendant is pro se. Court provides the copy of the letter dated Sept 6 from DA Karl Hayes outlining the hearing for today.  Defendant acknowledges paperwork. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. Court goes over the waiver to counsel. Attorney rights given. Defendant is voluntarily and freely waiving his right to an attorney. Defendant Joles pleads guilty in 22CF22 and defendant Joles pleads guilty to 22CF77. 
Defendant gives the Court two plea questionnaires for each case. Court speaks to those questionnaires. 
Court accepts the plea agreement.  Felony advisements given. State speaks to sentencing. Defendant makes a statement to the court and reads letter. Court speaks. 

Court finds defendant guilty on count one for 22CF22. Court imposes: 4 years in WPS with 4 years extended supervision, 217 days credit. Eligible for ERP and CIP. Conditions of probation are AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, any treatment deemed necessary, follow all recommendations set forth by probation, full time employment or education. Court costs in the amount of $518.00 payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Courts Office and a payment plan. 

Court finds defendant guilty on count one in 22CF77.  Court imposes: 1.5 years in WPS with 2 years extended super CONCURRENT to 22CF22 with 113 days credit. Eligible for ERP and CIP. Conditions of probation are AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, any treatment deemed necessary, follow all recommendations set forth by probation, full time employment or education and anger management deemed necessary. Court costs in the amount of $518.00 payable within 60 days to the Clerk of Courts Office and a payment plan. 

Court provided the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Defendant was advised to review, sign and return if he so choses.
Plea Negotiations

Defendant wishes to withdraw any and all motions and requests to move to plea and sentencing. Plea questioner handed to defendant by clerk. Advised to review and complete at time of plea and sentencing.

Defendant Matthew D Joles in court from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. He would like a public defender, which he was eligible for before he advised the court that he wanted to represent himself.  Attorney Jolin was in the court on another matter.  She will put him back on the list.
